reviews.text: Not the biggest of stations around with just 2 platforms, but staff and helpful, and there is space to wait inside when the weather is bad (although I expect that is only at certain times of day). There's a café as well and vending machines should you need them.
Lovely old station, with a fantastic cafe!

The station was designed by Weightman & Hadfield, Sheffield[1] in the Jacobean style, and built by James Drabble, Carlton in Lindrick. It was opened on 7 July 1849 by the Sheffield and Lincolnshire Junction Railway, part of the Manchester, Sheffield and Lincolnshire Railway. It was extended and further buildings added in 1900.[2]
Had to pick up some tickets from the machine roday, the staff member came out and showed me how to do it, very nice friendly man who clearly enjoyed his job.
